plot: Inept apprentice guardian angel Harmon Cavender is chastised by his superior and given a final chance to earn his wings by helping an unconventional big city woman, the young, socially awkward Agnes Grep.

Inept guardian angel Harmon Cavender is given a chance to finally earn his wings by helping an unconventional big city woman, the young, awkward Agnes Grep, who has just been fired from her job. Cavender doesn't ask what her wishes are; instead, he puts her in posh clothes, provides her with a fortune, and moves her uptown to a fancy Park Avenue address.—David Stevens

Agnes Grep is something of a klutz, forever getting into trouble and having just lost her job as a result. Enter her guardian angel, Harmon Cavender, something of a disappointment himself as he has yet to earn his wings. He's been given one last chance to get those and 24 hours to help Agnes out. His approach is unconventional, to say the least, and he doesn't quite understand what it takes to make her happy. It all works out in the end though, for both of them.—garykmcd
